data.text: @jeremyhinkle @StateHealthIN Even if that's true, what harm came from that?

@kevinmbrooks @StateHealthIN No question, covid helped kill lots of people (hospitals killed lots of people with covid too, by not treating with medicine that actually works). But there was definitely an incentive to label deaths as covid deaths - https://t.co/8pox33DhLT
@jeremyhinkle @StateHealthIN Do you have evidence of this mass fraud? And it still doesn't explain what caused the excess deaths.

@kevinmbrooks @StateHealthIN So like I said before, hospitals were incentivized to label as many deaths as covid deaths. So those covid numbers you mentioned are inflated. Imagine if hospitals started labeling everything as a flu death - there’d be MANY more than 60k deaths per year - maybe even 400k?
@kevinmbrooks @jeremyhinkle @StateHealthIN You know 100% that is not a factual statement.
@jeremyhinkle @StateHealthIN If there were a massive flu pandemic, maybe they would have.
@kevinmbrooks @StateHealthIN My evidence is that governments didn’t shut down countries over the flu. Tons of people die from the flu every year - I guess just not enough to strip rights away.

@jeremyhinkle @StateHealthIN What's your evidence that no one cares? There's a flu vaccine. Also, in the US, 12k-60k die from the flu per year. In 2020, there were about 400k excess deaths. The scale matters.
